messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Peaceful parenting tape to cd/MP3
messages.msgSnippet: -=-OK, I needed to record my Singathon tape to MP3 and did it, starting from clueless, using this as a guide:
messages.messageBody:
-=-OK, I needed to record my "Singathon" tape to MP3 and did it,
starting from clueless, using this as a guide:
http://lifehacker.com/software/mp3/alpha-geek-how-to-digitize-
cassette-tapes-222394.php
and using the free downloaded program, Audacity, that they explain in
the guide. When I got confused about labeling song tracks,
Audacity's help web site was good. And the cable was still $5 at
Radio Shack.

Pam-=-



Thanks, Pam. I printed that out to put with my collection of tapes
from conferences.

I think I might be getting recording equipment for Christmas, so I'll
stall a month. I appreciate the help various people have offered
very much, and the recording of Peaceful Parenting is here:

http://sandradodd.com/parentingpeacefully

Lauren and Lee Stranahan recorded that and helped me get it
shareable. Thank you.



Sandra




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Peaceful parenting tape to cd/MP3
messages.messageBody:
<<but they need a
cassette player (rarer every day), and it might be available to hear
online at some point in the nearish future.>>>
OK, I needed to record my "Singathon" tape to MP3 and did it,
starting from clueless, using this as a guide:
http://lifehacker.com/software/mp3/alpha-geek-how-to-digitize-cassette-tapes-222394.php
and using the free downloaded program, Audacity, that they explain in
the guide. When I got confused about labeling song tracks,
Audacity's help web site was good. And the cable was still $5 at Radio Shack.

Pam



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
